page.title: 06ENTERTAINMENT IN MARSKE AREA
page.content: There is very little going on in the way of entertainment. Dances, Domino drives and Whist drives are held in Marske Village Hall, four or five times a year. Reeth Young Farmers Club also uses the Hall for Discoes. The Church holds a Harvest Supper in October, and the Women's Institute have a Carol Service at Christmas. Also at Christmas there is a Party for the children and Senior citizens. Some people occasionally visit the Georgian Theatre in Richmond and travel to Newcastle, the nearest place at which to see Shakespeare plays performed. Almost every house has a television set.
